intro: Ligusticum lucidum subsp. cuneifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved angelica, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in forested areas. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
